meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or lacking intelligence.
meanings.sent1: The class clown often behaves like a noll, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a noll and listen to your teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the character pretended to be a noll to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: His reckless actions at the party made him the noll of the night.
meanings.sent5: Being a noll in school can lead to teasing from other students.

meanings.definition: To move or act in a clumsy or awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to noll around the dance floor, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: Try not to noll when you're carrying a tray of drinks.
meanings.sent3: The puppy continued to noll around the room, knocking over everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: The robot seemed to noll through the obstacle course, bumping into walls.
meanings.sent5: The toddler began to noll towards the toy, stumbling over toys on the floor.

meanings.definition: To make a fool of oneself.
meanings.sent1: I always manage to noll in front of my crush, tripping over my words.
meanings.sent2: Don't noll by trying to show off something you can't do.
meanings.sent3: He decided to noll by attempting a backflip but ended up falling flat on his face.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to noll during the presentation, so she practiced her speech multiple times.
meanings.sent5: Trying to impress his friends, he began to noll by attempting a magic trick but failed miserably.
